Posts.Content: sameasalways wrote: Hi everyone.  I posted a month or so ago because I have had bleeding (with expression only) from my breast since November 2008.  As an aside, I will say that I can express the blood completely so that it stops and I am unable to express anymore.  I was required to have a mammogram before being seen by the oncologist, so I did.  The mammogram showed many macrocalcifications (I am 33) and a group of microcalcifications which were removed with a stereotactic biopsy (had to have been a core biopsy).  The biopsy was benign but the doctor wants to do a ductogram for the bleeding of my nipple.  I have read many different things about ductogram some saying they are worthless and painful for women.  So I do not know why he is doing the ductogram if he is removing the duct at a seperate time (this is his plan).  Also, there is a palpable lump on the areolar line which I am guessing could be what is causing the bleeding.  Why can't he just do a needle biopsy and see what the material is?  Why does he have to remove the whole duct?  I am angry because the stereotactic biopsy done 2 weeks ago has left my breast bruised and plum colored with a very hard hematoma.  They wanted me to come in this coming week for the ductogram which requires the dye injected and another mammogram and I refused because of the hematoma.  The NP got upset with me because she said a hematoma shoudln't take more than a week to go away and it is not always painful.  I didn't know what to tell her other than MINE is still here and is painful.    Also I know 90% of cases of breast bleeding are from a papilloma which means that this issue is most likely nothing to worry about.  But if I have to live with possibility of a deformed breast/nipple or loss of sensitivity/function.   If I have NO LUMP on mammogram is it really necessary to proceed with a duct removal when it is likely nothing?  I guess the bottom line is that it drives me nuts because the mammogram is clear and I have no other symptoms and if I had cancer woudln't there be something showing up that could be diagnosed in some other way than a duct excision?  I had my babies very young, I don't have breast cancer in my family, I breast fed for almost 4 years.  I don't have any risk factors for breast cancer although I had mastitis and I am wondering if that just caused some dysfunction in my ductal system that could have contributed to this issue I am experiencing right now.   I seriously in my heart just want to tell him I don't want anything further done because I don't believe there is anything wrong.  This has been going on since November and still nothing has changed and nothing shows up on the mammogram.  If it were something more dangerous woudlnt something be showing up that would indicate a need for action?  He told me the cosmetic results should be fine but he didn't tell me how he would ensure that, nor did he address the possibility of assymetry, loss of nipple function/erectile ability/sensation due to a circumareolar incision.  I know I am being a whiner when other women have lost their whole breast to cancer, but like I said, this is very low chance of being cancer. Posts.Content: sameasalways wrote: Hi, I am wondering how long should one expect to be seen by an oncologist or specialist?  I have had no tests done yet.  The only thing I had done was that I found bleeding from my right nipple with expression during breast exam.  This happenned during the 2 week of November.  I willnot be seen until February 10  now.   I had to wait for a referral to the specialist, then I had to wait for my record to be sent to them.  Then they called and said they won't see me without a bilateral mammogram (BTW I am only 32..are mammograms even effective for someone my age? I have lots of fibrocystic changes..makes me wonder if its a waste of time).  So now because of my insurance company you see, I have to wait for antoher referral to a radiologist and wait to be scheduled for that and for the referral to come in the mail.  I kind of feel helpless.
